text: Also, make sure your PV/PVC are set in "Retain" mode, could be "Delete" by default, which means that destroying the service would delete the DB storage too

elements.text: Also, make sure your PV/PVC are set in "Retain" mode, could be "Delete" by default, which means that destroying the service would delete the DB storage too

text: (if you use PG on K8S)
Take a look here for docs : <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/issues/440>

attachments.fallback: #440 Postgres PVC reclaim policy, could Delete the database by mistake
attachments.text:
Depending on how K8S clusters are deployed and using which hosting provider, we could have bad surprises

Postgres, if used in a K8S cluster, deploys a `StatefulSet` , which also creates a `PersistentVolume` for its data and a `PersistentVolumeClaim` to link the volume to the host that runs postgres container.

This persistent volume is created using a statefulset and its volumeClaimTemplates

`cluster/helm/splice-postgres/templates/postgres.yaml`  
`StatefulSet`  
`volumeClaimTemplates`  
`specs`  
`PersistentVolumeClaim`

If the `StatefulSet` is deleted (by mistake for example),and its PV/PVC has no `volumeReclaimPolicy` set, it would default to the `StorageClass` `reclaimPolicy`  
If the `StorageClass` `reclaimPolicy` is `Delete`, the PV and PVC are automaticaly deleted (bye bye data)

That could be OK for devnet & testnet where tests are done from time to time for Disaster Recovery.  
But for mainnet, it would be better to set the PVC `volumeReclaimPolicy` to `Retain` and make it overridable to `Delete` via a value
attachments.title: #440 Postgres PVC reclaim policy, could Delete the database by mistake

elements.text: Take a look here for docs :

root.text:
Hello, I'm new here and new to Canton networks.  I'm trying to spin up a devnet validator.

I believe my IP was proposed for white listing last week.  However I'm unable to confirm this, because I can't `curl` any of the SV nodes.  I get either `403 Forbidden` or no response (timeout) depending on which nodes I attempt to reach.

The IP I asked to white list is `35.211.249.102`
Some of the URLs I've tried (from that IP according to `<http://ifconfig.me|ifconfig.me>`) include
`curl -X POST <https://sv.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/sv/v0/devnet/onboard/validator/prepare>`
`curl -X POST <https://sv.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global/api/sv/v0/devnet/onboard/validator/prepare>`
`curl -sSL <https://scan.sv-1.dev.global.canton.network.sync.global/api/scan/v0/scans>`
`curl -sSL <https://scan.sv-2.dev.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/scan/v0/scans>`

These requests just time out.  So I'm not sure if the problem is that my IP isn't whitelisted, or I have the IP wrong, or something else on my end.  Any help is appreciated... thanks in advance.
